meta.title: Use advanced techniques to develop an electronics outcome
meta.purpose: This achievement standard involves using advanced techniques to develop an electronics outcome.

grade_descriptors.N1: Evidence does not reach the minimum threshold for Achieved-level indicators.
grade_descriptors.N2: Some Achieved-level indicators are met, but not enough to satisfy all required Achieved criteria.
grade_descriptors.A3: All Achieved-level indicators are met; no Merit-level indicator meets the Merit threshold.
grade_descriptors.A4: All Achieved indicators are met and at least one Merit indicator is met, but overall performance is below the Merit threshold.
grade_descriptors.M5: All Achieved indicators are met and the Merit threshold is reached; no Excellence-level indicator meets the Excellence threshold.
grade_descriptors.M6: All Achieved indicators are met, all Merit indicators are met, and at least one Excellence indicator is met, but overall performance is below the Excellence threshold.
grade_descriptors.E7: All Achieved and Merit indicators are met and the Excellence threshold is reached, but not all Excellence indicators are met.
grade_descriptors.E8: All Achieved, Merit, and Excellence indicators are met.

omis.description: Shows a working electronics outcome developed using appropriate resources and techniques.
omis.detection_hint: There must be explicit evidence that the outcome functions as intended (e.g., demonstration logs or written descriptions). Stating intentions or plans without showing operation is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: develop a functional electronics outcome
The electronics outcome meets specifications
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Achieved bullets 1–2); Achieved commentary: first two paragraphs

omis.description: Provides evidence of testing and debugging using devices or strategies to ensure performance to specifications.
omis.detection_hint: Evidence must include explicit testing activity (e.g., testing expected, boundary, and invalid inputs) and debugging actions linked to outcome specifications. Generic assertions that 'it works' are insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: testing and debugging to ensure that the electronics outcome performs to specifications
tested the input interface on expected analogue/digital inputs
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Achieved bullet 2); EN4 examples list

omis.description: Explains the interfaces and functions of components and systems used in the outcome.
omis.detection_hint: Explanation must describe what each interface/component does and how it functions within the system. Listing names or parts without functional description is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: explaining the interfaces and functions of components and systems
functions of at least three interfaces/components
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Achieved bullet 3); Achieved commentary: explanation guidance

omis.description: Explains relevant implications for the electronics outcome (e.g., end-user, functionality, usability, safety).
omis.detection_hint: Must name each implication, explain why it is relevant, and describe how it is or could be addressed in the outcome. Vague or generic mentions are insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: explaining relevant implications
explained at least two identified relevant implications
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Achieved bullet 4) and EN5; Achieved commentary: implications paragraph

omis.description: Uses at least two advanced techniques appropriate to the outcome such as embedded software, subsystem design, or PCB development.
omis.detection_hint: Explicitly show evidence of at least two advanced techniques implemented (e.g., embedded software, subsystem level design, remote control, advanced PCB development, EEPROM storage, ADC). Listing possibilities without implementation evidence is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: They have used at least two advanced techniques
Examples of advanced techniques may include: using embedded software, subsystem design, or ADC
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN3 examples; Achieved commentary: advanced techniques evidence

omis.description: Identifies what the electronics outcome does and how components work together to achieve this behaviour.
omis.detection_hint: Must include both behaviour (what the system does) and function (how the components interact). Describing parts in isolation is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: identifying the behaviour and function of the electronics outcome
explained what the system will do and how the components work together
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Merit bullet 1); Merit commentary: first paragraph

omis.description: Shows testing and modifying actions that enhance the reliability of the electronics outcome.
omis.detection_hint: Evidence must link testing with modification activities that improve reliability (e.g., using testing devices/strategies, changing board layout, improving component selection). Correcting small code errors alone is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: testing and modifying to ensure reliability
made significant improvements by changing components and reorganising the circuit layout
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Merit bullet 2); EN4 examples; Merit commentary: testing/modifying reliability

omis.description: Evaluates the choice of components and systems used by comparing alternatives and providing reasons for choices.
omis.detection_hint: Include evaluative comparison and reasoning about why selected components or systems were preferred. Simple description without evaluation is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: evaluating the choice of components and systems used
comparing these with other options and providing reasons
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Merit bullet 3); Merit commentary: evaluation guidance

omis.description: Shows how at least two relevant implications have been addressed in the outcome through design or development decisions.
omis.detection_hint: Must connect specific implications to implemented changes or design choices. Listing implications without evidence of how they were addressed is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: addressing relevant implications
shown how their electronics outcome addresses at least two relevant implications
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Merit bullet 4); Merit commentary: implications addressed

omis.description: Undertakes iterative improvement throughout design, development, and testing to produce a high-quality outcome.
omis.detection_hint: Evidence must show multiple deliberate cycles of testing and refinement throughout the design and development stages. A single improvement or linear process is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: undertaking iterative improvement throughout the design, development and testing process
multiple instances of ongoing design, development and testing
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Excellence bullet 1); Excellence commentary: iterative improvement

omis.description: Justifies the choice of components and systems used with reference to investigations, comparisons, or outcomes achieved.
omis.detection_hint: Provide a reasoned justification supported by evidence or comparison criteria. Listing advantages without linking to the chosen design decision is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: justifying the choice of components and systems used
investigating and comparing alternative components and interfaces
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 EN2 (Excellence bullet 2); Excellence commentary: justification example

change_log: Integrated EN3 and EN4 examples from AS91894 to refine detection hints for advanced techniques and testing/modifying/debugging.
Updated weightings for reliability and advanced technique OMIs to 2 due to critical presence across Merit and Achieved commentary.
Clarified scope of 'relevant implications' and refined iterative improvement evidence for alignment with Excellence commentary.
